text:
Cannot build Apache on Windows with MSVC++ 6 ... get the error:

./include\apr_ldap.h(127) : fatal error C1189: #error :  Support for LDAP v2.0
toolkits has been removed from apr-util. Please use an LDAP v3.0 toolkit.

There are *no* instructions anywhere on the Apache site, nor in the docs, nor in
the README files about what to do with the toolkit once you have it in order for
Apache to compile.

README.ldap has some vague instructions, but they are not correct for Win32.
Copying apr_ldap.hw and placing the Netscape/iPlanet LDAP libraries in
srclib/ldap does not remove this error.

creator: pencilethics@gmail.com
text:
If you use the latest version of Platform SDK and make sure that the include and
lib folders of the SDK come before that of Visual C++ 6.0, then it will compile.
Otherwise you are technically not using the latest version of the Platform SDK,
which the Win32 Compile Instructions tell you to do. (The Platform SDK that
comes with Visual Studio 6.0 uses LDAP v2; the "latest" Platform SDK uses LDAP v3. 

By latest I mean the Windows Server 2003 or Windows XP SP2 SDK, although the SDK
for Windows Server 2003 SP1 should work. I built the trunk with the Windows XP
SP2 SDK and it built fine.
